CatDescriptText: Cutline of possible related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 17, 1969, pg. 3, reads: "New Policy on Hill - At the corner of Center [Centre] Ave. and Crawford St. where a large billboard warning Downtown Urban Renewal that it must not move past that point appeared several months ago..."The Pittsburgh Outdoor Advertising Company's billboard reads: "Attention City Hall and U.R.A. NO Redevelopment beyond this point! We Demand: Low Income Housing for the Lower Hill - C.C.H.D.R., N.A.A.C.P., Poor People's Campaign, Model Cities."
TitMainTitle: Billboard inscribed "Attention: City Hall and U.R.A. No Redevelopment Beyond This Point! We Demand Low Income Housing for the Lower Hill, C.C.H.D.R., N.A.A.C.P., Poor People's Campaign, Model Cities," at Crawford Street near intersection of Centre Avenue, Hill District
